components.description:
A bookmark, as used to mark one's place in a book. May also represent bookmarks on an internet browser. Appearance varies across platforms, but generally depicted at a 45° angle as a thin, white or red strip with a decorative tie and design, such as flower or star.

May be used for various content concerning reading, labeling, or tagging.

WhatsApp’s bookmark is purple. Twitter’s design shows a red bookmark in a closed book, similar to previous designs from Microsoft. Twitter and Google’s designs previously featured a blue bookmark.

Not to be confused with üè∑Ô∏è Label.
components.title: Bookmark

title: Bookmark

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A bookmark, used to keep track of the last page you read in a book. Not to be confused with the label emoji. Bookmark was approved as part o http://emojipedia.org/bookmark/
emoji_net_data.name: bookmark

bn:00105655a: Bearing or marked with a label or tag

bn:00090151v: Attach a tag or label to
To apply a marker to content or items (like photos or text) to identify certain types of information.

bn:13759356v: To add something to one's Favorites folder.
To add to one's list of favorites on a website that allows users to compile such lists.

bn:00049557n: A brief description given for purposes of identification

bn:00012136n: A slip of paper, card, etc. used to mark one's place in reading a book; a bookmark.
A Bookmark is a thin marker, commonly made of card, leather, or fabric, used to keep the reader's place in a book and to enable the reader to return to it with ease.
A thin marker used to keep one's place in a printed work and to be able to return to it with ease.
A strip of material used to mark a place in a book.
Strip used to mark a place in a book.
A marker (a piece of paper or ribbon) placed between the pages of a book to mark the reader's place

bn:00075885n: A label written or printed on paper, cardboard, or plastic that is attached to something to indicate its owner, nature, price, etc.
A slip of paper that entitles the owner to use a means of public transport such as trains or buses.
